instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..
definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EMC3814
threads.message:
Hi,

Apologies I can't seem to find the board number. Client has liquid damage.  She said was WAS turning on so she took to Apple for a checkup, they told her to replace entire unit and now the unit does not turn on at all.  I have examined the board, there was a lot of water in the macbook but the board seems OK visually.  On the touchpad there was a little corrosion which could be the cause of the issues (assuming the On button runs through the KB as in the past.

Obviously without a board number I can't get a schematic or provide any useful info to you!

Where might I find a board number?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EMC3814
threads.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.google.com/search?client=firefox-b-d&bih=866&biw=1680&hl=es&sxsrf=ALeKk02WmHsPZISAUQflu36iTd4q0sCp9Q%3A1594804887583&ei=l8oOX9SVI6OGjLsP3bu5yAs&q=<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>+EMC3814+logic+board&oq=<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>+EMC3814+logic+board&gs_lcp=CgZwc3ktYWIQAzoRCAAQsAMQigMQtwMQ5QIQiwM6BwghEAoQoAE6BAghEBU6BgghEAoQFVCj4PgnWM74-Cdg_fr4J2gBcAB4AIABa4gBpgiSAQQxMi4xmAEAoAECoAEBqgEHZ3dzLXdpergBAg&sclient=psy-ab&ved=0ahUKEwiUvb2W987qAhUjA2MBHd1dDrkQ4dUDCAs&uact=5[/URL]

Is it <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?

Did Apple say it is not under warranty?
Be sure of that before start the repair.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EMC3814
threads.message:
HI

Sorry I am not sure I understand your question. 

The device may be under Apple original warranty period but is now void due to water damage, or is there something here I do not understand?

Apple have told her to replace the entire logic board at her cost.

Cheers

James

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EMC3814
threads.message:
Did you try the board alone on the desk?
Use only charger, nothing else connected and check if voltages appear on the big coils.
